solution_line_template: Since the distance between city A and B is {dist_AB} miles, and city B and C are {dist_BC_more_than_AB} more miles apart than city A and B, then city B and C are {dist_AB}+{dist_BC_more_than_AB} = <<{dist_AB}+{dist_BC_more_than_AB}={dist_BC}>>{dist_BC} miles apart.
The plane's total flying distance between cities A and C is {dist_AB}+{dist_BC}= <<{dist_AB}+{dist_BC}={dist_AC}>>{dist_AC} miles.
The distance between city C and city D is twice the distance between city B and city C, meaning city C and city D are {multiplier_CD_BC}*{dist_BC} = <<{dist_CD}={dist_CD}>>{dist_CD} miles apart.
The plane flies a distance of {dist_AC}+{dist_CD} = <<{dist_AC}+{dist_CD}={total_distance_AD}>>{total_distance_AD} miles from city A to city D.
